The Rosetta Stone Discovery: This would be an epic adventure film that follows the journey of French soldiers as they discover the Rosetta Stone in Egypt. The movie would showcase the incredible historical significance of the stone and how it helped to unlock the secrets of ancient Egyptian hieroglyphics. The film could also explore the challenges faced by the soldiers as they navigated through the harsh Egyptian desert and the treacherous terrain.

The Magna Carta: This would be a drama film that portrays the events leading up to the signing of the Magna Carta in 1215. The movie would focus on the political and social tensions between King John and his barons, and the role of the Magna Carta in resolving these tensions. The film could also explore the impact of the Magna Carta on the development of modern democracy and human rights.

The American Revolution: This would be a historical action film that follows the events of the American Revolution from 1775 to 1783. The movie would showcase the bravery and determination of the American colonists as they fought against the British Empire. The film could also explore the role of key figures such as George Washington, Thomas Jefferson, and Benjamin Franklin in shaping the course of the revolution.

The Fall of the Berlin Wall: This would be a drama film that portrays the events leading up to the fall of the Berlin Wall in 1989. The movie would focus on the political and social tensions between East and West Germany, and the role of key figures such as Mikhail Gorbachev and Ronald Reagan in shaping the course of history. The film could also explore the impact of the fall of the Berlin Wall on the world and the rise of the Soviet Union.

The Battle of Waterloo: This would be a historical action film that follows the events of the Battle of Waterloo in 1815. The movie would showcase the bravery and determination of the armies of Napoleon Bonaparte and the Duke of Wellington as they fought for control of Europe. The film could also explore the impact of the battle on the course of European history and the rise of nationalism.
